explanation: The code used min(d_list) but it should use max(d_list). The program compares two possible total costs and one option applies the largest available discount (the maximum d), so taking the minimum element was incorrect. I fixed that single line by replacing min with max.
fixed_code:
n, p, q = map(int,input().split())
d_list = [int(e) for e in input().split()]

a = max(d_list)

print(min(p-q+a,p))
